abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Forestry Resource Management Project
            (FRMP) in Ghana. The project was the first Bank project
            directly in support of the Ghana's forestry sector. The
            project was intended to sharpen the focus of natural
            resource management in Ghana through the achievement of
            three main objectives: (i) managing industrial forestry
            production based on a sustainable yield policy; (ii)
            promoting conservation and fuelwood tree planting to
            counteract fuelwood shortages and environmental degradation;
            (iv) and sector institutional strengthening and reform. The
            overall assessment of Project outcome is that despite
            initial implementation delays, the project has
            satisfactorily achieved the bulk of its major objectives.
            The Bank's performance in identification and project
            preparation was generally satisfactory. The Borrower's
            performance, while unsatisfactory in the early years of the
            project, was generally satisfactory from the mid-term review
            to the end of the project. The main lessons learned from
            FRMP are as follows: (i) to properly address natural
            resource management issues and identify and test sustainable
            solutions, a long-term perspective must be taken; (ii) the
            underlying basis for any Natural Resources Management
            Project (NRM) is an effective policy environment and
            efficiently operating sector institutions; (iii)
            institutional strengthening often means substantive
            fundamental change to how institutions are organized and
            managed and therefore requires good planning and sufficient
            implementation time; (iv) sustainable NRM can only be
            achieved when resource-owning local communities are fully
            involved in the development of resource management plans and
            receive an equitable share of proceeds when the resource is
            harvested; and (v) it is imperative that NRM ministries and
            agencies responsible for setting policy and implementing
            development programs have effective support in resource
            economics and planning. NRM project is conceived as a 10 to
            15 years program, designed as a three-phase Adaptable
            Program Loan.

18150897.theme: Other environment and natural resources management,Environmental policies and institutions,Rural services and infrastructure,Export development and competitiveness
18150897.trustfund: TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF023450-CANADIAN CONSULTANT TF FOR ENVIRONMENT,TF024840-FOREST RESOURCES MGMT. PROJECT (FRMP),TF031693-GHANA - FORESTRY SECTOR
18150897.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Trade and integration

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is a policy reform,
            management strengthening and institution building operation
            aimed at : (i) managing industrial forestry production and
            export earnings in accordance with sustained yield policy;
            (ii) promoting conservation and tree planting on farms to
            counteract fuelwood shortages and ecological deterioration;
            and (iii) strengthening the sector institutions. These
            objectives will be achieved through : (a) improved
            protection and management of the high forest, and policy
            changes in forest fees and concession allocation procedures;
            (b) development and implementation of a rural forestry
            program with special emphasis on priority areas in the
            savannah zones; and (c) the strengthening of forestry
            education and research.
